body: Buckets should almost never be publicly accessible (excepting when using them to host public static websites). Although there is nothing inherently insecure about buckets, access control misconfigurations and a lack of understanding about how buckets security works can turn buckets into a vector for attack and data exfiltration. To avoid this, Cyscale looks for publicly accessible buckets.
name: Ensure buckets are not publicly accessible
remediationDescription:
#### AWS

**From the Console**



Perform the following actions to block all public access for a bucket:



1. Open the security settings using the "Open in AWS" menu option
2. Select the tab `Permissions`
3. Under `Block public access (bucket settings)`, select `Edit` 
4. Check the `Block all public access` checkbox
5. Click `Save changes`



**From the AWS CLI**



```bash
aws s3api put-public-access-block --bucket <bucketName> --public-access-block-configuration "BlockPublicAcls=true,IgnorePublicAcls=true,BlockPublicPolicy=true,RestrictPublicBuckets=true"
```



**Default Value**



By default, new buckets, access points, and objects do not allow public access.



**References**



1. [Configuring block public access settings for your S3 buckets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/configuring-block-public-access-bucket.html)
2. [put-public-access-block](https://awscli.amazonaws.com/v2/documentation/api/latest/reference/s3api/put-public-access-block.html)
